question.text: The unique feature of Haldane's hot dilute soup was

options.text: its molecules did not show any degradation as there was no free oxygen and enzymes.
it had C, H, and O in gaseous form.
its temperature was suited to provide environment for formation of first cell.
it contained enzymes to accelerate reactions.

solution.text: According to Haldane, there was a time during the evolution of life when simple organic molecules (monomers) were just formed and they accumulated at the bottom of the sea. He called it hot dilute soup or primitive broth. They were no oxygen available at that time. Also, proteins were not formed yet and there were no enzymes. Hence there was no degradation of molecules.
